title: Donne Angular Latin ID
content:
Sorry for the somewhat low-res image from Amazon (and the scrolling), but can anyone help me out with this type family? It's been bugging me and I've been unable to divine its identity. It's a latin with a peculiar, sharply calligraphic feel. Thanks in advance.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131022102408im_/http:/typophile.com/files/donne_4468.jpg)
author: Reed Reibstein

comments.content:
It's Pegasus by Matthew Carter. There is a sample of it in my [Serif Font ID Guide](http://web.archive.org/web/20131022102408/http:/bowfinprintworks.com/SerifGuide/serifsearch.php). Just type "Pegasus" in the 'fuzzy search' space near the bottom of the page.

I don't believe it is available in digital release.

- Mike Yanega

Thanks a ton, Mike! I never would have thought this was one of Carter's, but I dug out "The Art of Matthew Carter" and there it is -- albeit one that he considers almost too much Berthold Wolpe's work to be his own.

Glad to help. We have had this one come up a couple of times here at the Board.

- Mike Yanega
